1.text:
In 2006, Coast-to-Coast AM radio received
an unusual dial-in. A woman identified only

8.text:
as “Jackie” called the station and claimed
that whilst working at NASA in 1979, she’d

14.text:
witnessed a government cover up. Not only
was NASA in touch with alien civilizations,

21.text:
but it was also building human colonies on
Mars.

25.text:
Jackie had worked on the Viking Project – the
first U.S mission to land on the Red Planet.

31.text:
Its cameras had revealed two humanoid figures
walking across its surface. Her superiors

36.text:
immediately locked and taped up the door so
no one could see in. The event was never spoken

42.text:
of again. So, why the cover up – what was
NASA trying to hide?

45.text:
Jackie’s story was never verified, but her
testimony is far from unique. Thousands of

50.text:
claims have been made charging NASA with hiding
its links to alien civilizations. Are we being

55.text: tricked? Has NASA discovered an alien civilization?

58.text:
Jackie might be a questionable source, but
verified NASA employees have also come forward

63.text:
with evidence. Former NASA astronaut Dr. Brian
O’Leary said “Civilizations have been

68.text:
visiting us for a very long time…these visitors
use the technologies of consciousness…[and]

75.text:
they use co-rotating magnetic discs for their
propulsion systems”.

80.text:
KIC 8462852 may be the key to this mystery.
NASA has collected data on the star for 4

91.text:
years. Its unique light patterns suggest artificial
structures are harvesting its energy. Penn

97.text:
State astronomer Jason Wright says this is
evidence of an “alien mega-structure”.

103.text:
Other top scientists such as Yale Researcher
Tabetha Boyajian make similar claims.

109.text:
In January 2015, Toby Lundh was live streaming
International Space Station footage when a

115.text:
UFO appeared. NASA shut down the camera for
15 seconds. When it came back on, the object

122.text:
had gone. This was the second incident of
its kind in a week. Lundh captured a still

128.text:
of the image, which he claims proves that
NASA is working with extra-terrestrials.

134.text:
However, Lundh is also part of an online conspiracy
community with no formal aerospace training.

141.text:
NASA’s response to previous allegations
is that objects appearing to be UFOs are in

146.text:
fact space debris. There are over 500,000
man-made objects orbiting Earth at 17,500

154.text:
miles an hour. These range from rogue satellites
to meteoroid parts. Switching off a camera

162.text:
might be a safety measure as debris comes
perilously close.

166.text:
KIC 8462852 might be the closest we’ve come
to finding aliens, but there’s insufficient

173.text:
evidence to make solid claims. While the media
was quick to jump on an extra-terrestrial

179.text:
conspiracy, it failed to report later findings
by NASA’s Spitzer Space Telescope. Dr. Massimo

187.text:
Marengo collected the star’s infra-red signals.
The data was consistent with theories that

192.text:
unusual light levels were due to a swarm of
comets circling the star.

198.text:
In January 2016 Nobel Prize winning astronomer
Bradley E. Schaefer allegedly found errors

204.text:
in both the comet and alien megastructure
hypotheses. If he’s right, maybe there’s

211.text:
something even bigger going on. Something
we don’t yet have the technology to understand.

217.text:
But anomalies remain. In 2010 WikiLeaks published
diplomatic cables that raised some intriguing

224.text:
questions. A classified email from Albinas
Januška – advisor to the Lithuanian Prime

229.text:
Minister – stated “there are a group of
UFOs who are making influence [sic.] on the

233.text:
cosmos”. Other hacked cables from senior
sources, including a Japanese Chief Cabinet

239.text:
Secretary and Tajik Parliamentary Chairman,
also seemed to confirm alien life.

246.text:
Perhaps most revealing, however, was a Tweet
from former senior Presidential advisor John

251.text:
Podesta. On February 15th 2015, Podesta wrote
“Finally, my biggest failure of 2014: Once

259.text:
again not securing the #disclosure of the
UFO files”.

264.text:
And Podesta had a point. Were there nothing
to hide, would NASA continue to stonewall

269.text:
the release of files relating to known UFO
investigations, such as the 1965 fireball

275.text:
sighting in Kecksburg, Pennsylvania? Podesta
is now Hillary Clinton’s Presidential Campaign

281.text:
Manager. He is credited with Clinton’s promise
to release UFO files if she is elected.

288.text:
Until these documents are declassified we
can only speculate as to whether NASA has

292.text:
discovered an alien civilization. Government
refusals to make all UFO investigations public

298.text:
suggest that the issue is not as clean cut
as it is claimed.

302.text:
Whether this is a simple matter of national
security, or something more sinister, is a

308.text:
question only harder evidence can answer.
If Hillary trumps the 2016 election, it may

314.text: only be a matter of time until we find out.
